Last night, Russian Kh-101 cruise missiles and Geran-2 drones struck the "Concern Electron" plant in Lviv City. The full extent of the damage is unknown. 
This plant was previously targeted on July 12, 2025.
Coordinates: 49.842332, 24.002155
Edit: I'm aware the geolocation proof is wrong. The coordinates are correct though.

Last night, 3-4 Russian Kh-101 cruise missiles impacted the Motor Sich Plant in Zaporizhzhia City. 
Locals report that Building 113 was the main target, which was used for producing engines for aircraft, drones and other light aviation. A large fire broke out afterwards.

Russian forces have captured the village of Bezsalivka, Bilopillya direction, Sumy Oblast. 
Pre-war population: ~60.
Total land area: ~0.62km¬≤.

Russian forces have captured the town of Shcherbynivka, Kostyantynivka direction, Donetsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~3,266.
Total land area: ~5.92km¬≤.

Ukrainian forces have re-established control over the village of Andriivka-Klevtsove, Prosyana direction, Donetsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~777.
Total land area: ~3.66km¬≤.

Russian forces have captured the village of Novoheorhiivka, Pokrovske Direction, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~34.
Total land area: ~0.25km¬≤

If you currently live in Ukraine or Russia and feel comfortable with getting in contact with me, please DM me. I‚Äôm looking to increase the scope of my sourcing and reliability of the information I provide, especially on Russian and Ukrainian attacks. 
You will remain anonymous, and in complete control of the information you choose to provide, and how you provide it. I will only publish information that you allow me to, and that doesn‚Äôt put anyone from any side at risk. This will be extremely beneficial to my reporting. 
My telegram account: 
@AMK_Mapping1
. I also have Signal if you prefer that.

AMK Mapping

Russian forces have captured the village of Maliivka, Pokrovske Direction, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~163.
Total land area: ~1.27km¬≤.

Some general updates that I think are important to mention:
Kucheriv Yar (Dobropillya direction) remains under Russian control and has been used for new advances in multiple directions. The newest attacks have been taking place to the rear of the stronghold village of Shakhove, which Russia is trying to cut off by reaching Toretske. A strong push is also being made from Poltavka.
As for the Russian soldiers who were encircled last week, I wanted to wait a little to confirm this, but roughly 20 POWs were taken, around 15 of which surrendered near the small road north of Zolotyi Kolodyaz. The other ~5 were caught in the forests to the southeast. Everyone else was either killed or managed to escape back to the Kucheriv Yar area.
Russia has now regained the initiative in the Dobropillya direction and is making significant progress. I will post more on that later, though.

In the Bilopillya direction, Russian forces resumed their assault operations and managed to complete the capture of Bezsalivka.
After weeks of positional battles, with Ukraine holding no permanent presence in the village, Russian forces began attacking towards the western houses, which were subsequently captured. They were also able to improve their positions in the forested area to the north and secured another section of the forests along the international border.
+ ~1.13km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

Israeli defence Minister Israel Katz stated that the Knesset has approved the IDF ground operation aimed at occupying all of Gaza City. 
He stated that this operation will take place through "heavy fire, civilian evacuation, and ground maneuver," and threatened to flatten the city if Hamas doesn't accept Israel's terms, including freeing all hostages and completely disarming.
Our boy is out here doing side quests...
Our boy is out here doing side quests...

I thought it was AI generated at first 
ü§£

Major attack on Slovyansk and Kramatorsk, Donetsk Oblast just now. 
At least two Iskander-M ballistic missiles, several KAB glide-bombs and as many as 10 Geran-2 drones hit the cities, with Kramatorsk appearing to have taken the main hit. 
More KABs are flying in their direction.

Major attack on Slovyansk and Kramatorsk, Donetsk Oblast just now. 
At least two Iskander-M ballistic missiles, several KAB glide-bombs and as many as 10 Geran-2 drones hit the cities, with Kramatorsk appearing to have taken the main hit. 
More KABs are flying in their direction.
A UAV launched by the Houthis in Yemen was intercepted by the Israeli Airforce after it flew over the Egyptian border towards the Gaza envelope. Sirens sounded in multiple Israeli settlements.

Another drone from Yemen flew in from the southwest and began flying parallel with the Gaza border. Multiple interceptors were used, all of which failed to intercept it, reportedly resulting in fighter jets being scrambled. A helicopter was eventually able to shoot it down.  
As for the reports on supposed rocket launches from the Gaza Strip coinciding with the drone flight, I haven‚Äôt seen any information to suggest this actually occurred yet.

An Initiative Doomed To Failure. Russia Has Firmly Rejected The Idea Of NATO Peacekeepers
Proposals by European leaders to send military forces into Ukraine have been met with strong opposition from Russia. 
"All these plans essentially involve providing guarantees through foreign military intervention in part of Ukrainian territory. I very much hope that those hatching such plans are simply trying to attract attention, but I also hope they understand this would be absolutely unacceptable to the Russian Federation," said Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov.
Earlier, Dmitry Medvedev, the deputy head of Russia's Security Council, responded more harshly to French President Emmanuel Macron: 
"The brainless Gallic rooster can't let go of the idea of sending troops to 'Ukraine.' It's been explicitly stated: NO NATO troops as peacekeepers. Russia won't accept such a "security guarantee." But the hoarse, pathetic bird continues to crow to prove it's king of the coop". 
Read more 
HERE

U.S. Says Senior ISIS Member Was Killed In Northern Syria Raid 
The United States Central Command (CENTCOM) announced on August 22 that its forces killed a senior ISIS member during a raid in northern Syria three days earlier.
The terrorist was a key financier who planned attacks in Syria and Iraq, the command said in a statement, adding that he had relationships throughout the ISIS network in the region, posing ‚Äúa direct threat to U.S. and Coalition forces and the new Syrian Government.‚Äù
‚ÄúWe will continue to pursue ISIS terrorists with unwavering determination, throughout the region‚Äù said ADM Brad Cooper, Commander, CENTCOM. ‚ÄúTogether with our partners and allies, CENTCOM remains steadfast in our commitment of ensuring the lasting defeat of ISIS and the protection of the U.S. homeland.‚Äù
Read more 
HERE

Ukraine Has New Heavy Cruise Missile 
Ukraine has developed a new land-attack cruise missile dubbed ‚ÄúFlamingo‚Äù with a claimed maximum range of 3,000 kilometers.
Efrem Lukatsky, a photojournalist of the Associated Press, was the first to reveal the existence of Flamingo in a post on Facebook on August 17. He said that the missile was developed by a Ukrainian company called Fire Point.
‚ÄúUkrainian-made over 3,000 km range Flamingo missiles, which were launched into serial production, are seen in a workshop of one of the country‚Äôs leading Fire Point defence company..."
The very next day, Ukrainska Pravda released two videos of Flamingos being launched with the assistance of a detachable rocket booster from rails mounted on two two-axle trailers. The Ukrainian outlet also revealed that the missile carries a warhead weighing 1,150 kilograms.
Read more 
HERE

Ukraine has developed a new land-attack cruise missile dubbed ‚ÄúFlamingo‚Äù with a claimed maximum range of 3,000 kilometers.
Efrem Lukatsky, a photojournalist of the Associated Press, was the first to reveal the existence of Flamingo in a post on Facebook on August 17. He said that the missile was developed by a Ukrainian company called Fire Point.
‚ÄúUkrainian-made over 3,000 km range Flamingo missiles, which were launched into serial production, are seen in a workshop of one of the country‚Äôs leading Fire Point defence company..."

Price of Death, Price of Peace: U.S. Bows Out, Europe Picks Up  the Tab, Ukraine Disappears
Russian-aligned outlets claim hackers pulled a Ukrainian General Staff database listing about 1.7 million service members killed or missing. Kiev predictably dismissed the figure as a fake. Even so, if that headline number were real and paid at Ukraine‚Äôs legal death-benefit rate, the compensation bill alone would overwhelm state finances for decades.
Under Ukrainian law, the one-time benefit is 15 million hryvnia per fallen soldier. Multiply that by 1.7 million and you get about 25.5 trillion hryvnia (roughly $600+ billion at recent rates)‚Äîthe equivalent of several years of Ukraine‚Äôs total government spending. Even if the real toll were half that, the obligation still looks like a multi-decade burden once you add disability payments, widows‚Äô pensions, medical rehab, housing, and demobilization costs‚Äîall on top of a shrunken tax base.
Read more 
HERE

Maduro Vows To Mobilize Millions As U.S. Warships Nears Venezuela
Venezuela President Nicol√°s Maduro on August 18 said that he would deploy 4.5 million militia members in response to ‚Äúoutlandish threats‚Äù by the United States.
The administration of U.S. President Donald Trump has been slowly escalating against Venezuela, using the problem of drug trafficking as a pretext.
In February, it designated Venezuelan criminal group Tren de Aragua and a number of Mexican drug cartels as global terrorist organizations.
Furthermore, the U.S. announced earlier this month that it had doubled the reward for the arrest of Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro from to $50 million. Maduro was accused by the Trump administration of being ‚Äúthe world‚Äôs biggest drug trafficker‚Äù and of working with cartels to smuggle fentanyl-laced cocaine.
Read more 
HERE

Russian Orlan-30 Can Now Carry FPV Drones
The Russian military has reportedly modified its Olan-30 reconnaissance drones to carry and deploy smaller first-person video (FPV) suicide quadcopters.
The Orlan-30, which was developed by the Saint Petersburg-based Special Technology Center on the bases of the Orlan-10, is one of the main drones currently in service with the Russian military. The drone has an operational range of 120 kilometers and an endurance of more than eight hours. It features an advanced electro-optical system with a laser designator.
A photo showing an Orlan-30 carrying two FPV quadcopters under its wings somewhere over the special military operation zone in Ukraine surfaced online on August 22. The photo was likely taken from the video feed of a Ukrainian FPV interceptor drone that was chasing the Orlan-30.
Read more 
HERE

In Video: Russian Special Forces Raid Ukrainian Fortified Post
Rare video footage showing a raid by Russian special forces on a fortified position of the Ukrainian military in the special military operation zone surfaced online on August 21.
It is unclear where exactly the raid took place. Information on such special operations are scarce, and while they are conducted by different Spetsnaz [Russian for special forces] units of the Russian military on a regular basis, they are usually kept under tight wraps.
The footage suggests that the night-time raid was carried out by a small squad, all equipped with night vision goggles and silenced assault rifles.
The special forces operators took out a few Ukrainian troops who were outside the position, before storming it. They are later seen in the footage clearing nearby trenches and a small underground bunker. Most of the position‚Äôs garrison were killed. Only the few who decided to surrender survived the raid.
Read more 
HERE

North Korea Airs First Footage Of Bulsae-4 Long-Range ATGM From Russia‚Äôs Kursk
North Korea‚Äôs state TV on August 22 aired for the first time footage showing the Bulsae-4 non-line of sight (NLOS) anti-tank guided missile (ATGM) in action against Kiev forces during the battle of Kursk in Russia.
The Bulsae-4 was first spotted in Kursk last year, right after Kiev forces launched a surprise offensive there. However, the deployment of the system was not acknowledged by Russia or North Korea until now.
The system is typically mounted on the M-2010 6√ó6 wheeled armored vehicle, or a special military mini truck. However, the footage aired by Korean Central Television revealed that a version of the system based on a regular pickup truck was deployed in Kursk.
In footage, a missile fired from the system is seen shattering what appears to be a mine-resistant ambush protected vehicle of Kiev forces.
Read more 
HERE

Mass Desertion of AFU Recruits En Route to the Frontlines
Footage has emerged online, filmed by a mobilized AFU serviceman, showing a nearly empty bus heading towards the front lines. 
Of the 40 recruits who were initially on the vehicle, 30 did not reach the destination.
 According to the author of the video, the soldiers left the bus during stops along the route.
A representative of Russian security services commented on the incident. He noted that such cases point to a growing awareness among AFU servicemen of the dire situation on the front and the futility of further combat operations. The source emphasized that many Ukrainian soldiers are unwilling to sacrifice their lives under conditions where the outcome of the conflict is seen as virtually predetermined.
